revised_title: Caesium Ions Nuclear Resonance Chemical Shifts in Solutions
tldr: The authors measured chemical shifts in nuclear resonances of caesium ions in various solvents and found that the shifts are nonlinear with concentration. They used a radial distribution function to calculate the shifts and found that the direct interionic interactions are responsible for the nonlinearity. The study provides a better understanding of the mechanism behind the chemical shifts and the cause of the nonlinear concentration dependence.
